result.execSummary:
The defendant Lazerick Demonte Head was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Mistreatment of Animals, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 951.02.
  • Mistreating Animals - Intentional Or Negligent Violation, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.02.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
*8/25/2022  Honorable Jeffrey A. Wagner:  Restitution made payable to MADAAC.*
Court orders RESTITUTION in the amounts of $275 and $600.

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
No ownership or training of animals for 5 years.
Additional programming needs to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Court orders defendant to pay $500 fine as to count 1.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data bank.
The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges including the DNA and victim/witness surcharge and /or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections and as a condition of probation/extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

charges.descr: Mistreating Animals - Intentional Or Negligent Violation

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lazerick Demonte Head

records.addlTxt: Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, for review. spc
Letter from DOC seeking a review of the defendant's probation term.
Restitution to be made payable to MADACC.

Defendant Lazerick Demonte Head in court with attorney Eric m Hailstock.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNTS 1 and 2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire and jury instruction received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint/Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 12 MONTHS in HOC, with credit for 0 days time served, consecutive to count 2. 

AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 6 MONTHS in HOC, with credit for 0 days time served, consecutive to count 1.

The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  

The Court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a total period of 3 YEARS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA and victim/witness surcharge) and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections and as a condition of probation/ extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
-Additional programming needs to be determined by the Department of Corrections.
-No ownership or training of animals for 5 years.

*Court orders defendant to pay $500 fine as to count 1.
*Court ordres RESTITUTION in the amounts of $275 and $600.

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
The defendant is advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.

Defendant Lazerick Demonte Head in court with attorney Eric m Hailstock.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense request an adjournment. For reasons presented to the Court. Case adjourned, branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Lazerick Demonte Head in court with attorney Eric m Hailstock.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Lazerick Demonte Head in court by video with Attorney Eric Hailstock who appears in person.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Ossanna. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Defendant not to possess any animals of any kind.

Defendant Lazerick Demonte Head in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2: Defense counsel challenged probable cause which was then denied by the Court.
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count(s).
Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/15/22 @ 1:30p
